Until I get that sorted, lots of good things happening on the Facebook page, so go like the page to get it delivered in your stream if that’s your thing.

Alternatively, you can follow us on Twitter (if that’s more your thing).

Fri, Aug 23, 2013 at 09:05pm

[gallery]

Muji Stationary - Sometimes the best stationary is also the most affordable. The A5 notebook, and 0.38mm gel ink pens have been my stationary loves for many years.

Fri, Aug 23, 2013 at 12:37am

[youtube www.youtube.com/watch

Bullet Journal - It’s not very often that something comes along and blows my mind. I’ve been struggling with a way to keep my notes organised with a way to reference them at a later date. This system looks like it could be the perfect ticket.

(Source: http://www.youtube.com/)

Nightvision

Stunning time-lapse work by Luke Shepard in the creation of Nightvision, which is described as:

… a celebration of the brilliance and diversity of architecture found across Europe.

(Source: https://player.vimeo.com/)
Wed, Aug 14, 2013 at 04:51pm

[youtube www.youtube.com/watch

Grasshopper Divert

I love these small incremental progress videos that SpaceX keeps posting, documenting their quest for a completely reusable rocket. This one shows the Grasshopper taking off at an angle, hovering for a little, correcting it’s path and then landing back on it’s base.

Reach for the stars!

(Source: https://www.youtube.com/)
Wed, Aug 14, 2013 at 11:39am

[gallery]

The Olympic City

The Olympic City is an ongoing photography project by Jon Pack and Gary Hustwit (director of the Helvetica, Objectified and Urbanized documentaries) that looks at the legacy of the Olympic Games in former host cities around the world.

The printed version is limited to 1000 copies, and retails for $100. However there is much more affordable (and manageable) digital copy which can be found here.

Tue, Aug 13, 2013 at 04:13pm

[gallery]

Hyperloop

We’ve been waiting a long time for Elon Musk to reveal his idea for the future of public transportation, Hyperloop. The post also has a link to a pdf (which doesn’t work at the moment).

More detail can be found on the Businessweek website.

Tue, Aug 13, 2013 at 12:54am

[vimeo 67692057 w=500 h=281]

Last video I post (for today at least).

There is so much in this world that we honestly take for granted - that old bottles obviously get recycled and used again for new bottles. Apparently until recently that’s not actually been the case.

How a used bottle becomes a new bottle.

(via Kottke)

(Source: https://player.vimeo.com/)
Mon, Aug 12, 2013 at 04:52pm

One of my absolute favourite artists, Hiroaki Samura draws Manji from his manga series ‘Blade of the Immortal’. What I love about this video is how Samura achieves the soft shadows and shading - lots of pencil and delicate eraser work, over the basic image which is light boarded from below.

It’s also interesting to see that he’s using some tracing paper to avoid smudging his work as it’s mainly pencil work and doesn’t involve any inking.

Mon, Aug 12, 2013 at 04:01pm

<p>While I’m down this rabbit hole. Otomo senior (that’s Katsuhiro Otomo) is releasing an omnibus of 4 shorts under the ’Short Peace’ banner. Was released a few weeks ago in Japan.</p>

Here’s the trailer.
